description: CRITICAL: Hide implementation details and expose minimal interface. Make fields private by default, expose behavior not data, and follow Law of Demeter (principle of least knowledge).

do.description: Hide implementation details behind clean interfaces
content: Expose behavior through methods, not raw data
Follow Law of Demeter (principle of least knowledge)
- No direct access to internal state
- Law of Demeter: only talk to immediate friends

dont.description: Don't use getters/setters as glorified public fields
content: Don't use getters/setters as glorified public fields
Don't return references to mutable internal state
Don't chain method calls through multiple objects
getItems() { return this.items; }  // exposing mutable state
setItems(items) { this.items = items; } // public field disguised
- Getters/setters for every field (just use public fields)
- Instead of getItems(), provide addItem(), removeItem()
- Instead of getTotal(), calculate internally when needed
- Return defensive copies if must return collections
- Focus on BEHAVIOR not data access
